Detailed Description

MPEG-4 Simple Profile and H.263 Baseline video decoder interface for sciCOS 3020.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::~ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder (   )  [virtual]
 

Destructor.

Member Function Documentation

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::AllocateOutputBuffers (  UINT8 &  out_buf_count,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len
)  [virtual]
 

Allocates a number of output buffers that are used to store the decoded (and post-processed) frames.

Parameters:
out_buf_count Desired number of buffers to be allocated in the output buffer array. If set to 0, the default number of buffers will be allocated. On return, the actual number of buffers, i.e. the ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder can adapt the number passed in by the caller if necessary.
out_buf_len Desired length (in bytes) of one output buffer (all buffers have the same length). If set to 0, the default length will be used. On return, the actual buffer length, i.e. the ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder can adapt the length passed in by the caller if necessary.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

Implements VideoDecoder.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::DecodeFrame (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
UINT16  flags
)  [virtual]
 

Decodes a video frame. The input buffer contains always one complete frame. The actual decoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when the decoding process has finished, the callback function CbVideoFrameDecoded will be invoked.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the video input buffer (containing the encoded frame).
in_buf_len Length of the video input buffer (in bytes).
flags Bit flags as defined by the FlagsType enum indicating if it is the last frame in the stream/file.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameDecoded

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::DecodePacket (  const UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
UINT16  flags
)  [virtual]
 

Decodes a video packet. Contains one or more packet but the packets are always complete. The actual decoding is done asynchronously, i.e., when a complete frame has been decoded, the callback function CbVideoFrameDecoded will be invoked.

Parameters:
in_buf Pointer to the video input buffer (containing the encoded packets)
in_buf_len Length of the video input buffer (in bytes).
flags Bit flags as defined by the FlagsType enum. It indicates if it is the last packet in the frame and if it is the last frame.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameDecoded

Implements VideoDecoder.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::Flush (   )  [virtual]
 

Cleares all output and input buffers of the decoder. The currently active decoding process will complete as usual. After this the decoder deletes all pending DecodeFrame() requests and cleares all internal buffers of the decoder. The input buffers already given to the decoder will be released by the decoder at the capture buffer manager.

Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::GetCapabilities (  CodecManager::VideoCodecCapabilities &  caps  )  [virtual]
 

This function is used to retrieve the capabilities of the video decoder (VideoDecoder sub-class).

Parameters:
caps On return, it contains the capabilities. Note: The caller has to create this object (with arbitrary values) before calling this function. The passed object is then filled with the correct values by the VideoDecoder sub-class.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::GetNumberOfInitialDecodeOperations (  UINT8 &  operations  )  [virtual]
 

Gets the number of recommended (preferred) initial DecodeFrame calls for stuffing the decoder.

Parameters:
operations On return, the recommended number.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::GetOutputFrame (  const UINT8 HUGE *  dec_out_buf,
UINT8 HUGE *  dest_buf,
UINT32 &  dest_buf_len
) 
 

This function is provided for test purposes. It is used to get (copy from) a video decoder output frame, i.e., the content of the output buffer of the decoder is copied into a given destination video frame buffer. The caller has to provide this buffer and ensure that the length of it is sufficient for the video frame, i.e., in general, it should be equal to the length of the decoder output buffer.

Parameters:
dec_out_buf Pointer to the decoder output buffer from which the video frame content is taken.
dest_buf Pointer to a buffer where the video frame content shall be copied to.
dest_buf_len Length of the dest_buf (in bytes). On return it contains the actual length of the filled buffer.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::GetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
 

This function retrieves the values of specified parameters in the video decoder.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be retrieved.
values_array On return, array of the retrieved parameter values. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type. The caller has to allocate memory for this array before invoking of this function. The existing elements of the array are then filled with the corresponding parameter values by the video decoder.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and types_array i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions (  UINT32  context,
CbFrameDecoded  cb_frame_decoded,
CbInBufferFree  cb_in_buf_free
)  [virtual]
 

Register callback functions.

Parameters:
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that is valid for all callback functions registered with this instance of the ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder. This context is then passed as an argument of all callback functions invoked by the ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder.
cb_frame_decoded A pointer to a callback function that is invoked by the ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder when a frame has been decoded (and post-processed) and is ready for rendering.
cb_in_buf_free A pointer to a callback function that is called by the ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder when a video input buffer is not used anymore by the decoder (as the data has been already decoded) and can be re-used.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::ReleaseOutputBuffer (  const UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf  )  [virtual]
 

It releases the output buffer of the decoder and, thus, allows the decoder to fill it with new decoded (and post-processed) frame if available. In general, this function is a notification that is called when the corresponding frame has already been rendered and the renderer (Display device) does not need the content of the buffer any more.

Parameters:
out_buf Pointer to the video output buffer that shall be released.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
SkipFrame

Implements VideoDecoder.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::SetOutputFrame (  const UINT8 HUGE *  src_buf,
UINT32  src_buf_len,
UINT8 HUGE *&  dec_out_buf
) 
 

This function is provided for test purposes. It is used to set (copy to) a video decoder output frame, i.e., the content of a given source buffer is copied into the output buffer of the decoder.

Parameters:
src_buf Pointer to the source buffer from which the video frame content is taken.
src_buf_len Length of the src_buf (in bytes).
dec_out_buf On return, the pointer to the decoder's output buffer where the video frame content has been copied to.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::SetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
const UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
 

Sets dynamically one or more decoder parameters.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be changed. The corresponding values to be set are delivered in values_array.
values_array Array of the values to which the corresponding parameters have to be set. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and values_array, i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoDecoder::SkipFrames (  const UINT8 HUGE **  out_buf_array,
UINT8  out_buf_count = 1
)  [virtual]
 

Skip one or more frames, i.e. it releases the specified output buffers of the decoder and, thus, allows the decoder to fill it with new decoded (and post-processed) frames if available. In general, this function is called when the frames shall not been rendered at all.

Parameters:
out_buf_array Array of pointers to the video decoder output buffers that shall be released.
out_buf_count Number of elements in out_buf_array, i.e., number of buffers to be released.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
ReleaseOutputBuffer
